DataElement.preferredName: FACT-Br Questionnaire Social Family Well-Being Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the Social/Family Well-Being scale of the FACT-Brain questionnaire, a 50-item instrument that assesses general physical,  social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain  tumor-specific concerns.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-Br Questionnaire Social Family Well-Being Scale Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Outcome from the Functional Assessment of Chronic Therapy-Brain (FACT-Br) questionnaire's Social/Family Well-Being scale.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
A 50-item instrument that assesses general physical,
social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain
tumor-specific concerns.

Concepts.definition: A 50-item instrument that assesses general physical, social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain tumor-specific concerns.

Property.preferredDefinition: Role; the action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.:Family; a domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.:an ordered reference standard.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.
A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: FACT-BR Questionnaire Role Family Health Score
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition:
A 50-item instrument that assesses general physical,
social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain
tumor-specific concerns.:Role; the action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.:A taxonomic category between Order and Genus. It consists of a group of organisms among which the differences are quite minor, e.g. Equiidae - horses and their relatives.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A 50-item instrument that assesses general physical, social, emotional and functional well-being, as well as brain tumor-specific concerns.
The action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.
A taxonomic category between Order and Genus. It consists of a group of organisms among which the differences are quite minor, e.g. Equiidae - horses and their relatives.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for Duke study in Rave and C3D.
